post_text: MECHS will begin Phase Two of our Pandemic Response Plan on September 14th by transitioning into the "Switch-Back Hike" or hybrid model. Students will have the choice of returning to campus or remaining in the virtual learning platform. Students will have the ability to switch from in-person or virtual learning as desired. Each Thursday will be dedicated to virtual learning to make the transition smoother. Be on the lookout for more information and details to come! We can't wait to see you back at school.

post_text: Congratulations to Grace Teater from the White Site! Grace plans on finishing school at UNG and becoming a clinical therapist. Grace’s favorite quote is, “You don’t get rid of yesterday by talking about it all the time, you get rid of its effects on you by moving forward.” During her time at MECHS, she looked forward to break because she got to talk and mingle with new people. Grace feels that she probably wouldn’t be where she is today without her mentor. post_text:
Emma Flanagan is a senior from the White Site. Emma plans to attend Lanier Technical College and start her nursing career and hopefully become a surgical nurse. Emma’s favorite memory is when she finally finished her very last module and all the excitement just came flowing through her for finally finishing high school when she thought that would never happen. Mrs. Whitlock is Emma’s favorite staff member because she took the time out of her day or night to help Emma better understand what she was learning at the time. Mr. Tench, the Math teacher in the senior room, was the most helpful teacher for Emma.
Emma’s favorite quote: “I hope the fathers and mothers of little girls will look at them and say ‘yes, women can.” - Dilma Rousseff. Congratulations Emma! We are so proud of you! #classof2020 #graduation2020 #highschoolgraduation #mechsgrad2020 #mechsgrad #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance

post_text: Congratulations to Bowman Site senior Macy Miller! Macy plans to attend Georgia Southern University and major in interior design. Her favorite quote is “I believe every human has an infinite number of heartbeats. I don’t intend to waste any of mine. “ -Neil Armstrong. One of her favorite memories was when the students got to have a paint night in the lunchroom. post_text: Emily Torres is a Class of 2020 graduate from the Hill Center Site. Emily is also the recipient of a $5,000 scholarship. Her future plans are to study hard and get good grades in order to get into the Radiology Program at Lanier Tech. Emily's favorite memory at MECHS was trivia night and decorating cookies and ornaments at the December family night. Emily says, "The teachers in the peak room are very special to me, they encouraged me and motivated me when times were difficult. They even sent me a card in the mail when I started college. This simple action showed they cared for me and my future." Emily also enjoyed the non-traditional learning environment at MECHS while having her own independence and making her own decisions. Emily says, "I decided when I would go to school and how long I would be there. I set my own pace. I felt as I was taking control of my future." Congratulations Emily! We are so proud of your hard work. #classof2020 #graduation2020 #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #mechsgrad2020 #mechsgrad ##highschoolgraduation #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance

Jessica Garcia is a 2020 graduate from the Murray site. She plans to attend Dalton State College and work towards becoming an LPN and later a RN. Jessica wants to go into nursing because she has a heart for helping others. She hopes to be the first in her family to earn a college degree. Jessica can’t pick just one staff member, so she wants to say THANK YOU to everyone who believed in her and motivated her to finish her coursework and earn her diploma. Her favorite quote is from Kim Taehyung of BTS: “When things get hard, stop and look back at how far you’ve come. Don’t forget how rewarding it is. You are the most beautiful flower, more special than anyone in this world.”
Way to go, Jessica! We’re proud of your accomplishment!

post_text: Congratulations to Robert Holcombe, a senior from the Dawson Site. Robert is currently advancing in his position with Toyota while furthering his education in diesel mechanics.
